1. The highest mountain in North America is Denali, also known as Mount McKinley, with a peak elevation of 20,310 feet.
2. Denali is located in the Alaska Range, which is a major mountain range in the interior of Alaska.

The highest mountain in North America, Denali, is part of the Alaska Range, which is a subrange of the American Cordillera.
